member.name: T:TinyResort.TRChat
member.summary: Tools for sending messages to the chat box.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRChat.SendMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new chat message with the specified text.
member.param: The text you want shown in the chat message.
The name of the speaker for the chat message. Can be left blank to have no speaker shown.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRChat.SendError(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new chat message with the specified text. As an error, the text will be red.
member.param: The text you want shown in the chat message.
The name of the speaker for the chat message. Can be left blank to use "ERROR" as the name.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRChat.SendMessage(UnityEngine.Color,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new chat message with the specified text of the specified color.
member.param: The color of the chat message shown.
The text you want shown in the chat message.
The name of the speaker for the chat message. Can be left blank to have no speaker shown.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRLicences
member.summary: A framework for creating custom licences and using them to gate your mod's features behind player progression.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence
member.summary: Information and functions related to your custom licence.

member.name: P:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.level
member.summary: The player's currently unlocked level for this licence. If 0, the player has not unlocked this licence.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.SetColor(UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the banner for the licence. Keep in mind this will not change the color of the licence icon.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.SetIcon(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the icon used to represent the licence.
member.param: The path to the image file (including file name and extension) you want to use as an icon for the licence, relative to the BepinEX plugins folder.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.SetLevelInfo(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the description and cost for a specific level of the licence.
member.param: What level of the licence is being changed.
What description should be shown for that level.
How many permit points it will cost to buy this level.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.AddSkillRequirement(System.Int32,CharLevelManager.SkillTypes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes a specific level of the licence require a minimum level of a particular skill.
member.param: The level of the custom licence for which a prerequisite is being added.
What skill the player will need to level up in order to buy this level of the licence.
What level the needs to be at or higher than in order to buy this level of the licence.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.AddPrerequisite(TinyResort.TRCustomLicence,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes this licence only unlock for purchase if another licence has reached a minimum level.
member.param: The licence that must be leveled up in order to unlock your licence.
The minimum level the required licence must be to unlock your licence.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRCustomLicence.AddPrerequisite(LicenceManager.LicenceTypes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes this licence only unlock for purchase if another licence has reached a minimum level.
member.param: The licence that must be leveled up in order to unlock your licence.
The minimum level the required licence must be to unlock your licence.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRItems
member.summary: Tools for working with the Dinkum inventory.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRItems.GetItemDetails(System.Int32)
member.returns: The details for an item with the given item ID.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRMail
member.summary: Tools for sending the player custom mail.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMail.SendItemInMail(TinyResort.TRCustomItem,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the player a letter containing the given item.
member.param: The item you want to send.
How many of the item you want to include.
Normally, the player will recieve this letter upon waking up the following day. Set this to true to make it immediately arrive.
The ID of the NPC you want to have sent the letter. 1 = John

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMail.SendItemInMail(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the player a letter containing the given item.
member.param: The item ID of the item you want to send.
How many of the item you want to include.
Normally, the player will recieve this letter upon waking up the following day. Set this to true to make it immediately arrive.
The ID of the NPC you want to have sent the letter. 1 = John

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMail.SendItemInMail(InventoryItem,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the player a letter containing the given item.
member.param: The item ID of the item you want to send.
How many of the item you want to include.
Normally, the player will recieve this letter upon waking up the following day. Set this to true to make it immediately arrive.
The ID of the NPC you want to have sent the letter. 1 = John

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRQuickItems
member.summary: Tools for quickly creating clothing items.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRPlugin
member.summary: Information and functions relating to your plugin with respect to the TR toolset.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRPlugin.harmony
member.summary: A harmony instance created specifically for your plugin to use.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.Log(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs to the BepInEx console.
member.param: The text to post in the console.
If true, this message will only show in the console if the config file has DebugMode set to true.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.LogWarning(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs a warning to the BepInEx console.
member.param: The text to post in the console.
If true, this message will only show in the console if the config file has DebugMode set to true.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.LogError(System.String)
member.summary: Logs an error to the BepInEx console.
member.param: The text to post in the console.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.QuickPatch(System.Type,System.String,System.Type,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Allows you to patch methods using only one line of code instead of three per method patched.
member.param: Typically typeOf(className) where className is the class you are patching in Dinkum.
The name of the method in Dinkum being patched.
Typically typeOf(className) where className is the name of your class (the one that contains the patch method).
The name of the prefix method doing the patching.
The name of the postfix method doing the patching.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.AddCommand(System.String,System.String,System.Func{System.String[],System.String},System.String[])
member.summary: Subscribes to the save system so that your mod data is saved and loaded properly.
member.param: Subcommand to run.
Description to show if the user runs the help command.
Method to run when chat command is done.
The names of each argument your command takes. Used purely for the help description.
member.returns: A reference to all the commands for your mod.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.AddLicence(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a custom licence to the system. Must be done for each custom licence.
member.param: A unique string you are assigning this licence only. Changing this after save data has been made WILL result in save data mixups. Spaces in this are replaced with underscores.
The name that will appear on the licence in-game. (Can be changed at any time without issue)
The highest unlockable level for this licence. The true maximum is 5 since the game only shows up to 5 dots.
member.returns: The custom licence that is created. Save a reference to this in order to access its state at any time.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.GetSaveableItemID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this to get an ID that can be saved for both vanilla and modded items. If you manually save items in special storage slots, then save this value instead of the itemID. Then when loading data, call GetLoadableItemID() with the saved value to get the itemID of the item in that slot.
member.param: The itemID of the item. This its index in the Inventory.inv.allItems array.
member.returns: A string that is either the vanilla itemID or the customItemID for modded items.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.GetLoadableItemID(System.String)
member.summary: Use this to get the current itemID that matches a saved ID. If you manually save items in special storage slots, then use GetSaveableItemID for saving the item, and this method for loading it back in.
member.param: The ID that was saved for this item.
member.returns: An int that is the current itemID for this item. It matches the index of the item in the Inventory.inv.allItems array. Keep in mind that this value will change if a new mod is added or the mod loader has changed. So, if you want to save this value, you have to pass it through GetSaveableItemID() first and save the returned value instead.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.AddConflictingPlugin(System.String)
member.summary: Set a conflicting plugin to warn the user's about if they have it in their folder.
member.param: The GUID for the conflicting plugin.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRPlugin.PlayingWithConflicts
member.summary: If you want to do something specific if they ignore the warning, use this to check in Start()

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRData
member.summary: Tools for adding custom save data to your mod.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRData.SaveEvent
member.summary: Delegate for events related to points in the base game saving and loading.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.preSaveEvent
member.summary: This event will run just before the game saves and before the cleanDataEvent. This is where you want to ensure you have set all values that you wish to be saved.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.cleanDataEvent
member.summary: This is called before saving the game. If your mod adds anything to the base game's save file (such as custom objects in the world), then you generally need to remove that before the game saves. This is because if the player removes your mod, the game might freeze or crash when loading save data.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.postSaveEvent
member.summary: This event will run just AFTER the game saves and after the injectDataEvent.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.injectDataEvent
member.summary: This is called both after the game is saved and when loading in. In your subscribed method, you should carry out any consequences of the data being loaded. For instance, if you have a custom item in the game and the player has it according to your mod data, then here is where you'd actually give it to the player.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.initialLoadEvent
member.summary: This event will run just AFTER a save slot is loaded from the main menu. Useful for resetting values that shouldn't persist when loading into another save file.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.preLoadEvent
member.summary: This event will run just BEFORE a save slot is loaded.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRData.postLoadEvent
member.summary: This event will run just AFTER a save slot is loaded, just before the ijectDataEvent.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRData.Subscribe(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes to the save system so that your mod data is saved and loaded properly.
member.param: The name of your save file. Could be anything unique, but I recommend using the GUID of your plugin.
If true, then this data will be saved to a global save file used for all save slots. Otherwise, your save file will be specific to each save slot.
member.returns: A link to the data for your mod. Keep a reference to this. It is used to get and set all saved values.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRData.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves any values that have been set to a mod-specific file in the current save slot folder.
member.param: The name of your save file. Could be anything unique, but I recommend using the GUID of your plugin.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRModData
member.summary: Container for custom save data and functions used to affect it.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRModData.SetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores an object in the save data for your mod. Can be called either when an object is updated or during a preSave event.
member.param: An identifier for the variable. Can simply be the name of the variable.
The object that you wish to save. Must be a serializable type.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRModData.GetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the stored value for an object of the given name in your mod's save data.
member.param: An identifier for the variable. Can simply be the name of the variable.
If the value you're getting has never been set, this value is returned instead.
member.returns: The object that are loading. You need to cast this to the desired type, but be sure to check if it is null before doing so.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRModData.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the given variable from the save file completely.
member.param: The name of the variable.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRModData.Save
member.summary: Manually creates or updates a save file specific to your mod.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRModData.Load
member.summary: Manually loads a save file specific to your mod, if one exists.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRExtensions
member.summary: Just a few useful methods.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRExtensions.DeepCopy``1(``0)
member.summary: Allows you to copy any class or data structure by value rather than reference in order to change things about a copy without changing the original.
member.param: The class/object to copy.
member.returns: The new copy of the class/object.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRExtensions.CopyComponent``1(``0,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Creates an exact copy of a component and adds it to the gameobject.
member.param: The component to copy.
The gameobject you want to add the copy to.
member.returns: A reference to the new copy.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRExtensions.CompareListOfStrings(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Lets you compare a base string with a list of other strings and finds the closest matches.
member.param: The string you want to compare your list against.
A list of strings to see which ones are the closest.
member.returns: A list of strings holding all of the strings with the minimum required of steps.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRObjects.InstantiateObject(System.String,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Searches for and instantiates an object while storing it in a Dictionary to avoid duplication.
member.param: Location of the GameObject you would like to instantiate, i.e. "MapCanvas/Menu".
Parent object you would like to attach your button too.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRObjects.GetObject(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the game object at the specified location from a pre-prepared dictionary.
member.param: Location of the GameObject you would like to return, i.e. "MapCanvas/Menu".

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRObjects.CreateButton(System.String,UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Events.UnityAction)
member.summary: Creates a button based on a game object and attached it to a parent object.
member.param: Location of the GameObject you would like to instantiate, i.e. "MapCanvas/Menu"
Parent object you would like to attach your button too.
The text you would like the button to show.
Font Size of the button's text.
The method you would like to have run when the button is pressed.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRTools
member.summary: Used mostly for initialization and internal control of the API's features.

member.name: F:TinyResort.TRTools.InMainMenu
member.summary: Tells you if the player is in the main menu or not.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRTools.Initialize(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the Tiny Resort toolset
member.param: Your plugin. When calling this from your plugin, simply use 'this'.
The ID of your mod on nexus. This is the number at the end of the URL for your mod's nexus page. (A mod page does not need to be published in order to have an ID)
What short text you want associated with your mod when using chat commands. If you put 'tr' for example, then all your chat commands start with /tr

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRTools.TopNotification(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays a notification at the top of the screen right away rather than waiting on any previous notifications.
member.param: Large text at the top of the notification.
Smaller descriptive text below the title.
If true, a sound effect will be played.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRAssets
member.summary: Tools for importing custom assets.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRAssets.ListAllTextures(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of all files in a folder that can be imported as a texture (or sprite). Includes subdirectories.
member.param: Path to the folder that you want to be scanned, relative to the BepInEx plugins folder.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRAssets.ListAllFiles(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a list of all files in a folder that have one of the specified extensions. Includes subdirectories.
member.param: Path to the folder that you want to be scanned, relative to the BepInEx plugins folder.
Any number of file extensions (without the dot).

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRAssets.LoadBundle(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an asset bundle from the plugins folder.
member.param: Path to the asset bundle, relative to the BepInEx plugins folder.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRAssets.LoadTexture(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an image file from the plugins folder as a texture.
member.param: Path to the image file, relative to the BepInEx plugins folder.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRAssets.LoadSprite(System.String,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Loads an image file from the plugins folder as a Sprite.
member.param: Path to the image file, relative to the BepInEx plugins folder.
The center of the sprite. Vector2.zero would be the top left and Vector2.one would be the bottom right.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRInterface.CreateButton(TinyResort.ButtonTypes,UnityEngine.Transform,System.String,UnityEngine.Events.UnityAction)
member.summary: Create a button using pre-determined assets in the API.
member.param: The only current option is MainMenu. This looks like the main buttons on the screen (i.e. Main Menu).
Put the transform of what you want to attach the new button too.
The text on top of the button.
The method you want to run when clicking the button.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRInterface.DrawCircle(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Color,System.Single,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Creates a sprite in the shape of a circle with a border.
member.param: The radius of the circle (in pixels).
The color of the circle.
Thickness of the border to the circle (in pixels). Set to 0 to have no border.
Color of the border.

member.name: T:TinyResort.TRMap
member.summary: Map-related tools, such as easy map markers.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.Refresh(System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Sprite,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets a list of usable markers, removing excess markers or creating new ones as necessary.
member.param: Helps organize markers by mod and use.
How many markers are needed at the moment.
Sprite to use for the map marker.
Width and height of the map marker in pixels.
member.returns: A list of all active map markers.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.SetMarkerPosition(System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Positions a map marker based on an object's world position.
member.param: Helps organize markers by mod and use.
The index of the marker you want to reposition.
The world position of the object (or location) the marker represents. Typically, this will be the object's transform.position value.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.SetMarkerColor(System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Changes the marker's tint color.
member.param: Helps organize markers by mod and use.
The index of the marker you want to reposition.
The tint you want the marker to have. Pure white uses the sprite as is.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.CreateMarker(System.String,UnityEngine.Sprite,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new map marker.

Sprite to use for the map marker.
Width and height of the map marker in pixels.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.ReleaseMarker(System.String,TinyResort.MapMarker)
member.summary: Disables the marker and adds it back to the object pool for future reuse.
member.param: Helps organize markers by mod and use.
The marker that should be released.

member.name: M:TinyResort.TRMap.GetMarkers(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all map markers in the given category

member.returns: A list of all active map markers.

member.name: T:TinyResort.MapMarker
